bug.author: kellywzhang
bug.summary: [Bug] Error when I import gpytorch constraint
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I just installed gpytorch using conda. I get an error when I try to import constraints. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
Python 3.7.2 (default, Dec 29 2018, 00:00:04) [Clang 4.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_401/final)] :: Anaconda, Inc. on darwin Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
import gpytorch from gpytorch import constraints Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gpytorch/constraints/init.py", line 1, in from .constraints import GreaterThan, Interval, LessThan, Positive File "/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gpytorch/constraints/constraints.py", line 6, in from ..utils.transforms import _get_inv_param_transform, inv_sigmoid, inv_softplus ImportError: cannot import name 'inv_sigmoid' from 'gpytorch.utils.transforms' (/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gpytorch/utils/transforms.py)
<denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
0.2.1
1.1.0
Mac
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
It looks like gpytorch.utils.transforms was recently updated based on the github repo: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/master/gpytorch/utils/transforms.py>https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/blob/master/gpytorch/utils/transforms.py</denchmark-link>
Let me know if there is an error on my side.

comments.comment: 0.2.1 is quite an old version at this point -- does the problem still exist in 0.3.4 or on master? Everything seems to be working on my end.
Ah, I didn't realize my version of gpytorch was old. It's fixed now. Thanks!
